page.title: 20Local History (cont.)
page.content: possibly with sun worship. {Lewis Boys School. A land owner of the parish founded a boys school in the early 18th century. The site of the Edward Lewis' School is marked by a monument on Church Road {The Hengoed Viaduct. There is a magnificent viaduct at Hengoed,with its 16 arches straddling the Rhymney River and the main A469rd. It was designed in 1857 and enabled iron,coal and passengers to be carried to Newport and other areas. {Hengoed Baptist Church. At Cefn Hengoed stands the oldest worshipping church in Wales,founded in 1709. {___________________ {
